dcterms:creator: J. Andreas
D. Klein
S. Levine
dcterms:description: The Craft domain is a finite-grid world with objects of different types where the RL agent is instructed to visit some objects. It serves as a running example and is the basis for experimental comparisons.
dcterms:title: Craft domain

dcterms:creator: R. T. Icarte
dcterms:description: The Reward Machines Code provides the implementation for reward machines, which are automata representing the environment on a high level, allowing reinforcement learning agents to simulate experiences at all RM states.
dcterms:title: Reward Machines Code

dcterms:creator: R. T. Icarte
T. Q. Klassen
R. Valenzano
S. A. McIlraith
dcterms:description: The Craft domain is used in experiments to compare the performance of different reinforcement learning methods, particularly focusing on the integration of numeric features into reward machines.
dcterms:title: Craft domain (used in experiments)
